body.p:
ESX host commissioning is a functionality provided to a user to add additional ESX hosts to an already-activated cluster. While activating a cluster with a single host, local datastore is used for OVSvApp and nova proxy installation. If a new host is commissioned in this cluster and we try to vmotion by making the first host down, the nova proxy fails to migrate in the local datastore. In this case, you must manually migrate nova proxy datastore to the shared datastore and vmotion succeeds. Performing host commissioning after reboot of deployer node may fail if /tmp/helion_tls* certificates are wiped off during reboot. To overcome this issue the following playbook has to be executed: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts tls-reconfigure.yml
After running the preceding playbook execute this eon command eon resource-update <RESOURCE_ID> --action add_host --server-group <SERVER_GROUP> to perform host commissioning.

The following steps detail how to commission a new a host to an already activated cluster.
List the current state of the cluster using EON python client:# eon resource-list
For example:# eon resource-list +--------------------------------------+-----------+-------------+--------------------------------------+------------+-------+------------+------------+ | ID | Name | Moid | Resource Manager ID | IP Address | Port | Type | State | +--------------------------------------+-----------+-------------+--------------------------------------+------------+-------+------------+------------+ | 1228fce5-df5d-445c-834e-ae633ac7e426 | Cluster2 | domain-c184 | BC9DED4E-1639-481D-B190-2B54A2BF5674 | UNSET | UNSET | esxcluster | imported | | 469710f6-e9f2-48a4-aace-1f00cbd60487 | virtClust | domain-c943 | BC9DED4E-1639-481D-B190-2B54A2BF5674 | UNSET | UNSET | esxcluster | activated | | a3003a32-6e3a-4d89-a072-ec64a4247fb0 | Cluster1 | domain-c21 | BC9DED4E-1639-481D-B190-2B54A2BF5674 | UNSET | UNSET | esxcluster | imported | +--------------------------------------+-----------+-------------+--------------------------------------+------------+-------+------------+------------+
Add the host in the maintenance mode to the already activated cluster:
Any host that is in maintenance mode and without OVSvAPP will be considered as a new host to be activated. You can also activate multiple hosts.
Run the following command to update the cluster:# eon resource-update <RESOURCE_ID> --action add_host --server-group <SERVER_GROUP>This process moves the host to a folder in the Datacenter, spawns the OVSvApp VM, configures the networking, and triggers the Ansible playbooks on the new node. After successful execution, the host is moved back to the cluster.
For example:# eon resource-update 9ab2196d-37d2-4006-a2c7-08946b5194ea --action add_host --server-group RACK01 +-----------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +-----------------+--------------------------------------+ | id | 9ab2196d-37d2-4006-a2c7-08946b5194ea | | ip_address | UNSET | | name | compute | | password | UNSET | | port | UNSET | | resource_mgr_id | 9FDCFA66-6677-42A1-83FF-16DC32448021 | | state | host-commission-initiated | | type | esxcluster | | username | UNSET | +-----------------+--------------------------------------+
